content:
Genome Annotator - Eukaryotic Annotation Pipeline

nf-core/genomeannotator is a bioinformatics best-practice analysis pipeline for the annotation of eukaryotic genomes, with a primary focus on metazoans. It provides a comprehensive workflow for identifying and structuring genes in draft genomes.

Key Features

  • Built with Nextflow DSL2, using containerized processes (Docker/Singularity) for reproducibility and portability
  • Preprocessing and filtering of genome assembly contigs
  • Alignment of protein and transcript evidence to the genome
  • Gene model construction using AUGUSTUS and PASA
  • Consensus gene build generation with EvidenceModeler
  • Optional de-novo transcriptome assembly with Trinity
  • Optional annotation mapping from related genomes using Satsuma2 and Kraken

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Assembly Preparation: Filter and clean genome assembly contigs
  2. Evidence Alignment: Align proteins, transcripts, and RNA-seq data to the genome
  3. Annotation Support: Convert alignments to annotation evidence
  4. Gene Modeling: Build gene models using multiple prediction tools
  5. Consensus Building: Generate final consensus gene annotations

Input Requirements

Provide a samplesheet (CSV or TSV format) containing:

  • Genome assembly file (FASTA format)
  • Optional: Protein evidence sequences
  • Optional: Transcript evidence sequences
  • Optional: RNA-seq reads for de-novo transcriptome assembly

Supported Organisms

Primarily designed for metazoans (animals), but adaptable to other eukaryotic groups including fungi, plants, and protists with appropriate training data.

Output

The pipeline generates comprehensive annotation results including:

  • Gene structure predictions in GFF3/GTF format
  • Protein and transcript sequences (FASTA)
  • Evidence alignment files
  • Quality control reports
  • MultiQC summary report

Use Cases

  • Annotating newly sequenced eukaryotic genomes
  • Improving existing genome annotations with new evidence
  • Preparing genomes for NCBI GenBank submission
  • Comparative genomics studies requiring consistent annotation
  • Integration of multiple evidence sources for robust gene prediction

Note: This pipeline is part of the nf-core community-driven bioinformatics pipeline collection, ensuring best practices, rigorous testing, and continuous improvement.
